This song always makes me tear up, reminds me of my brother and I.  RIP Ceez.
Addiction stole my best friend of 32 years, we've literally been through all walks of life together since we were both 3 years old! I won't mention names because I still protect her, she didn't have an easy time in life, like most but she wasn't strong enough to face her demons and choose to numb herself instead. We've all been through terrible things in life but no matter what, nothing that happens to me in this life would ever make me pick up a pipe or needle, but it doesn't mean I don't have sympathy for others who aren't as strong and that's not me being nasty or negative and saying they are weak they've just been strong for too long and get to a breaking point it happens to the best of us. You can have sympathy but also boundaries I won't stay in touch with my friend when I know she's using so to not enable her in any way. You can't control what others do in life and the choices they make but you can be there to set the tone and say what you will and won't accept when it comes to addiction so you don't hurt yourself in the process. She's lost everyone family, friends and I've never given up on her or turned my back on her. Some may say why can't you be there for her during her bad times I am but when addicts won't accept help and they keep repeating the same cycles over and over again whilst watching the damage they are causing themselves is crazy...my friend got so bad in her addiction she nearly lost her life and instead of getting out and staying clean she continued to do what she was doing that landed her in hospital and with so many different health issues afterwards, it's lucky she's even still here and instead of appreciating her second chance she squanders it by choosing to continue this vicious cycle. It's hard to watch and it comes to a point where you have to say okay if I can't help and she won't do anything to help herself I need to take a step back for my own wellbeing and mental health it's not something that I'm hanging around to watch. You can't even begin to imagine the emotional turmoil it's caused me and that's down to the fact that I know who she is, she's a good person with a good heart and I absolutely love the ground she walks on but drugs turn her into someone else and not the person I know or love. Doesn't mean that I don't have hope that she can get clean, she can she just chooses not too and that's what happens with addicts they selfishly put it before everything and all of those that are involved that love them have to sit back and slowly watch the person they knew disappear.
Shit got me in tears rn

She watched me struggle for 4 years, she watched me lose everything that meant anything to me because of it. She still went out and followed in my footsteps. This song touches my heart so much, because I know what she's going through and I also know that I can't save her. She has to save herself.

Im a recovering heroin and fentanyl addict.  In truth, I should be dead.. but I made it through hell.  I heard this song on a random Playlist and started crying because it so accurately portrays the fight on the other side of an active addict.  The fight those who love us fight every day we continue to use.  Im one of the lucky ones.. but I don't have to be the only one.  Its possible to survive hell.  Addicts love too... and when we wake up, we can find that love again.    To those who'll know this is for them... Ask for help.   I know you cant imagine quitting but... ask.  Youll find it.

Better late than never and in some cases sooner the better. In Jesus name. Amen.

I listened to this song a lot last year. My mother was an alcoholic, and no matter what I did or said, I just couldn't get through to her. All I could do was watch her rot away. I felt this song in my heart every time I listened.  On August 5th, 2024, my Mom had a severe health scare. I thought I was going to lose her. I remember listening to this song again again just balling my eyes out.  Today, I'm beyond proud to say that she is officially 1 year sober!!! This song still draws tears to my eyes, but they are happy ones. I love my Mom so much.

Wow! That was great.  My eldest brother had an addiction to cocaine. As his kid sister (or 'Sid Kister', he'd sometimes call me), I looked up to him. He was smart and charming...eventually I grew up and realized how manipulative and deceptive he was...always had been...and I stopped answering his calls. I told him I was no longer making space in my life for toxic individuals, blood or otherwise, and I told him, "And as close as we were, I'm putting you at the top of the list."   It irritated him how I would no longer check on him, and it hurt Mom's heart how I was steadfast in my determination to never let him close to me again.  Everything happens for a reason, tho. And it's ironic how the one relative that no longer associated with him would be to one to single-handedly organize his funeral; thing is, he had died, to me, years prior.  I miss him sometimes. I hear his voice sometimes when I speak...his intonation and condescending sense of humor that I've somehow made my own (must be a family trait).   It's too bad really. I'd like to think that next lifetime, we'd meet again and could have a brother/sister relationship worth having.

LYRICS:  How can you love someone and learn to let them go? How can we fall apart on things we'll never know? And isn't it funny you can change your ways For someone to fill in your empty space? Tell me, is it really love if you have to ask if they'll stay? Yeah, I got somebody I love (yeah) Someone who's really important to me, but now they addicted to drugs (damn) Someone who not who they used to be and we ain't been keepin' in touch (yeah) I ain't gonna say any names at all 'cause I don't want no one to judge (whoa) But I wrote this song in hopes when they'll hear it, they'll never forget who they was I hope you feelin' your spirit enough (Joyner) I wanna just tell you I love you in case that you really don't hear it as much (whoa) I know we ain't talked in a while, but fuck it, I really don't care what it was I wanna reach out, but you keep on shuttin' me down, or you ain't been carin' as much And what the fuck happened to you? (Fuck happened to you?) You're losin' a fight (damn) I never thought I'd see the day that you let addiction ruin your life Everyone callin' that shit a disease and makin' you feel like you in the right But I hate the fact that you really be usin' that as an excuse to do what you like Or do what you might (do what you might, whoa) And I keep on prayin' and reachin' for you I hope you look in the mirror and see all the things I been seein' in you Hope your reflection'll send you a message and show you this shit is much deeper than you If you don't believe in yourself, then you'll never believe in somebody believin' in you When I gotta tell you truth (tell you the truth) 'Cause I'm 'bout to lose it (lose it) And you in denial about it and just wanna make up a million excuses Tearin' our family apart, but you'll leave us scarred and everyone bruises Every decision affectin' us all and if you get lost, then everyone loses For real And I'ma be next to leave I know that God got a plan and He ain't fulfillin' your destiny Much as I need you, I will not be stickin' around or watchin' you rest in peace I promise, I love you, but I gotta do what's best for me How can you love someone and learn to let them go? How can we fall apart on things we'll never know? And isn't it funny you can change your ways For someone to fill in your empty space? Tell me, is it really love if you have to ask if they'll stay? Look, I know you been callin' for me (yeah) You hittin' my phone, but I been alone so long I'm harder to reach (Joyner) I know you ain't say any names, but I got a feeling you talkin' to me I hate when these demons get into my soul, I feel like I'm caught in the beefs (uh) How do I let go of something I know is bigger and stronger than me? If I could be honest, I'll tell you the truth, I'm not who you want me to be (nah) Nobody is perfect, not even you, so why you keep targettin' me? I feel like we can't even have a genuine convo without you startin' to preach I feel like a dog on a leash, it's not what I need Livin' in hell, warned you when I gotta leave, like how can I breathe? And how you gon' tell me addiction's not a disease? Fuck do you mean? If it's not a disease, then why has it gotten to me? It's not what it seems But you always be makin' me feel like the problem's me I'm not gonna be who you want me to be, let God decide it for me And speakin' of God, how the fuck you know all of the plan's He's gotten for me? So give me a break I been inchin' away from tryna get outta this dream, I'm driftin' away How come you only there for me when I be tryna get clean? My biggest mistake Is me wishin' that things were different, I feel like the drugs is made for sinnin' It's why I been stuck in the same position, fuck I'm fallin', but I cannot budge Been wonderin' why I'm in love with a strange addiction And why the fuck you always playin' the victim Lot of this shit that you hate to mention It sucks 'cause I had to taint your vision But ain't nothin' left for me So you could just quit addressin' me I guess it's just my destiny So take me as I am or let me be, tired of you stressin' me 'Cause shit, I gotta do what's best for me How can you love someone and learn to let them go? That song hits me so hard, out of weed alcohol  coke meth  none of them are as hard to get off of as pain pills . I was off pill a toilet of 3 yrs, 2 yrd  of them I was on meth because it was the only way to stop. I stopped meth no problem,  was completely clean 1.5 years, tried to go back to work and my whole body hurt had no energy,  so I relapsed.  Now I'm on methadone to manage my addiction.  Haven't did illegal drugs in 7 years, but gotta have my methadone to function.  I've accepted  that I'll never be normal and completely clean. If someone hasn't experienced opioid addiction they need to keep there mouth shut. Because they have no idea what torcher is unless they have withdrawed from 160mg of oxytocin a day habbit. 7 years and I still crave those oxytocin couple times a month. Methadone stops giving you a high after you get stable for 6 months on a dose. So it's not trading one drug for another. It's taking a med to keep you from a year of torcher. Wanting to off your self every sec of everyday . I withdrawed over 4 months straight in jail .I never got over the sickness, can't sleep can't stand or sit or lay, can't eat. . I am state certified Peer Recovery Support Specialist who uses my lived experiences to help others find hope that recovery is possible. I can see both sides of the "fence". One thing I must point out to anyone who still thinks addiction isnâ€™t an addiction.  Youâ€™re simply wrong.  Itâ€™s a disorder of the brain in the same sense that schizophrenia is.  Yes, we make the decision to start using, but it is a very uninformed decision.  For the same reason we all agree that kids canâ€™t make informed consent to have sex with an adult, we shouldnâ€™t hold adults accountable for the poor choices they made at 14-17.  Obviously, nobody thinks it will turn into a compulsive behavior with uncontrollable bad behaviors.  If addiction wasnâ€™t a disease, everyone would just quit as soon as they start seeing negative consequences for their use.  We addicts are the type who keep spending money on drugs as we lose possessions, employment, friends and family.  Nobody does that unless thereâ€™s a mental disorder driving the behavior.

Let me say as an addict, this may suck to hear, but you REALLY know someone hooked on opiates/heroin/fentanyl and want to help? REALLY want it to work?  Take them to a methadone clinic.  Methadone will get rid of the withdrawals.  Some will say "trading one drug for another" ok. But its with a medical professional, and they wont die. They wont spend every dollar they have on it. Theyll get thru.   Eventually you can slowly lower the dosage and try to get off it. But its a way to quickly get them to get off without getting extremely sick from the withdrawals so theyll ACTUALLY DO IT. Thats the biggest progress you can make day 1, getting them used to not doing the substance their used to every single day.

not just addiction but the judgement we choose to impose on each other... Love <3 in the right ways for growth for belief in one's self.
Learning to love people often involves letting them go through progressions and processes of their traumas and happenings. Conflict in relationships is obstructed and toxified by so many devilish hindrances in this society that love and assessments of the real problems and equations is vital. Only you and God can completely know and figure that out. These types of reality songs help this movement of recovery. Entraping us in our minds to try to confine our afflictions, isolate us, and cause further damage, is often the devils plays upon such. Expression and genuine outletting of these complex emotions and variables is essential, it's partly why I write music, this creative outlet has blessed me with a therapeutic route to deal with internal, environmental, and external madness. God bless you, brothers and sisters, and I pray for you in your battles every moment.

I lost my parents at 16 and 17, lost my funding to go state college, my entire life was erased ... My sister lovingly forced a rat chau little dog on me, in my young years I disliked little dogs... I loved them both dearly, immediately. Sadly, my sister moved into the only home I ever known and brought her other dogs along... Long story short, big dog killed my sweet little male puppy. She ruined my early memories and my only home. I moved in with an ex's mom and had one little lady pup left... I was ripped apart, lost, and that little dog would stay by me until I fell asleep, but every morning, she came from downstairs Mom's room... After a few months I grew stronger and moved. Whisper, my little dog, was deeply depressed. She missed being the little but big dog to the pit bulls. She missed the steadfast calm of my ex's mum, Kim. Looking back, if I wasn't so numb from loss, I don't think I would have learned to do what I thought was proper. I asked if Whisper could stay with her known family. Ruling pitbulls and being grams number one... I have two kids now, years later, and that is still a top 3 of the hardest choices I had to make.... Whisper traveled with her grams thousands of miles on a Harley trike motorcycle and seen more in her sweet little life than I have! She deserved every inch, she and her brother changed and saved my life...Letting go is hard, but letting go might be the right choice. I was sad and lonely for a couple weeks, but seeing grams and Whisper dog pics, my heart doubled back, filled the hole within my heart, and learned the true meaning of love.... Through the pain of loss, I learned moments are priceless. I loved her as she was all I had after my parents passing away... She deserved to be happy, not stuck alone. RIP, Whisper.... Thanks for saving me, and thanks for being such an amazing dog to Kim.

Fentanyl or opioids arenâ€™t party drugs. Nobody whoâ€™s happy does something thatâ€™ll hurt them like that. I started using at a time I naively believed life wasnâ€™t worth living anymore. I went through agonizing physical pain, got in a horrendous wreck, broke my jaw, shattered by spine, ruptured a main artery and my appendix, and broke my leg. Had No pain meds. Heroin withdrawal hurts WORSE THAN THAT DID. Nobody wants to live in shame, and be treated like they just want a high. Once youâ€™re in this deep, theres no longer a high. You just have to function. This song is triggering if you've lived both sides of addiction. I've been the addict & now the recovered addict dealing with an addict. The 2nd verse, how the addict feels, is triggering AF! As an addict, we tend to be entitled and unforgiving to those who put up with us. Someone who cares about an addict will decide they can only be there for you when you're trying to get clean. It's not our place to love you to death. That's a figure of speech, not a reality anyone wants to live with.  So anyone reading this that's still an addict, get your shit together! Addiction has a cure it's called sobriety.  YOUR DISEASE IS CURABLE. ğŸ©·

My son is not locked up again...I am taking this time to bring food and blankets to the great people who found their life took a wrong course! My son is a addict but he is also a very loved human being! Love them when they are at their lowest! They need you more!
I lost my brother a year ago as of July 4th. This song is so very accurate and jelly really brings a powerful hook that drives home one of the most important questions an addict finds themselves asking. Once everyone had to turn their back I know my brother and so many others felt unloved and alone. But the verses tell the real story. The complexities between spending years wanting someone to see the decency in themselves and truly giving every last drop of care and hope they can even though they're angry, hurt, backstabbed. The issue of having to let go of the tethers holding someone together when all they want is to do right. All they want is the love which their addictions have corrupted. But at a certain point you have to live your life and let the chips fall. Because if you keep letting them cling to you, you will go down with them. Addiction is a true demon. Judge me if you wish. Trust me, I know there are a million things I could have and should have done differently. But I believe this execution couldn't be stayed. All addicts have a sense of loneliness that only another addict can truly understand. His was deeper than most. The only thing you can do is talk about it. Not the addiction, but the cause. Including myself I've never met an addict that wasn't using to cope with trauma. You have to heal in order to free yourself. Good luck to anyone reading this because if you're here you've been affected. Be strong, and be strong for the ones that need you. Rip Cody, I love you.

Let me explain why I'm currently hating this song. First off, this song reminds me of so many things. Relationships that have ended with friends due to od's, there's the fact that I was kinda able to get out of addiction, at least way more so than all my other old "friends". And now I've become completely addicted to this song listening to it on repeat. And now I hate how much I am getting from this song, even not on an addiction bases, because now I've listened to this enough that the words are starting to touch other areas of my life, things that I've made excuses about. So yes, I hate how much I actually love this song. It's just one of those songs, the subject matter reaches so many, but Joyner imo is good to the point you can use his songs for so many other things other than just the face value of the song.

I've been struggling with an addiction and it's costed me and my family thousands and more than just money. I'm only just recently recovering and putting my foot down. I've controlled a lot more of my life recently, and I'm very proud of how far I've come. I used to be an alcoholic and a 2 pack a day smoker. If I was awake, I was drinking.. Now I don't do either, and it's been so tough getting here. But whenever I want to give up, I remember that I wanted to give up yesterday. 1 year ago. 10 years ago.   Fall down 7 times   Get back up 8 times  We all can overcome, there's always a way.  You don't need to do it alone. There are others that want to help. This song really helped me remember to keep going. Helped me remember that I have come far. That I've made progress.   I cried a very good cry today, haha. Thank you
I graduated high school at 17, went into the military, all I did was go to the gym on base. I worked my ass off, I became the perfect soldier, I enlisted in E.S.T (Emergency Service Team) the equivalent of S.W.A.T... I participated in every opportunity to learn something new, sometimes I was chosen. I was only 18. Then I was introduced to cigarettes and alcohol... A year later I was discharged for substance abuse. I have never lost the guilt I feel from those days of walking through those buildings turning in my uniforms, handing over my military badge. I'm 36 now, this song brings up so much pain but offers a lot of clarity. I'm not dead. There's still time for me to improve, and for anyone with a goal in mind. Never forget why you started, never forget the people who are rooting for you.
I was always the person people wanted nothing to do with... I was the person that never was picked up for a game I wasn't ever the addictive personality type or the kind of person that could simply lose themselves in a unfamiliar situation with no light to spare    but people always leave correct I wasn't ever in in a state of existence perhaps most would not deem ideal shit kinda of was the only option when people didn't want me I couldn't help but find myself not lost not hopeless not even afraid   but I found myself in a place that I ought to have known for Jesus  had a way of going to find those who might not be the typical person his father would consider on the path but in the dust an in the dirt he who was lost I went and I found not seamlessly endless pits of substances or lust that words can help you to catch a case but it illuminated me from within sight set High seeking a pleasant place to in time perhaps find inclusion acceptance unity family love honor patience and joy   and I would soon find I had a shit ton of all that and more than I took strength from God who knows where but I took it I took it all smile hand shake hi five held a door for a stranger helped a lady in a hotel take her last night's dinner in a cardboard box to the trash because she was disabled and couldn't not get it all herself in one trip    a Dove that has been from plenty of places in witch I would be lucky to even deamn a way to divulge one's time life in travel butt to the local fags of Orlando Florida I have been forced to take each day alone but a afraid anymore but God forgive me for saying it but ever alone is a normal thing to anything but oc it's pertaining to yours truly the southern stan of the human man it's been a years experience with the way freedom  let it ring let it sing to clouds in 885 Crystal Bay Lane Orlando  albino niggger lives there in his details death and birth Michael Brown Chaflan  7563 Charlin Pkwy, Orlando, FL 32822

How can you love someone and learn to let them go? How can we fall apart on things we'll never know? And isn't it funny you can change your ways For someone to fill in your empty space? Tell me, is it really love if you have to ask if they'll stay?  Yeah, I got somebody I love (yeah) Someone who's really important to me, but now they addicted to drugs (damn) Someone who not who they used to be and we ain't been keepin' in touch (yeah) I ain't gonna say any names at all 'cause I don't want no one to judge (whoa) But I wrote this song in hopes when they'll hear it, they'll never forget who they was I hope you feelin' your spirit enough (Joyner) I wanna just tell you I love you in case that you really don't hear it as much (whoa) I know we ain't talked in a while, but fuck it, I really don't care what it was I wanna reach out, but you keep on shuttin' me down, or you ain't been carin' as much And what the fuck happened to you? (Fuck happened to you?) You're losin' a fight (damn) I never thought I'd see the day that you let addiction ruin your life Everyone callin' that shit a disease and makin' you feel like you in the right But I hate the fact that you really be usin' that as an excuse to do what you like Or do what you might (do what you might, whoa) And I keep on prayin' and reachin' for you I hope you look in the mirror and see all the things I been seein' in you Hope your reflection'll send you a message and show you this shit is much deeper than you If you don't believe in yourself, then you'll never believe in somebody believin' in you When I gotta tell you truth (tell you the truth) 'Cause I'm 'bout to lose it (lose it) And you in denial about it and just wanna make up a million excuses Tearin' our family apart, but you'll leave us scarred and everyone bruises Every decision affectin' us all and if you get lost, then everyone loses For real And I'ma be next to leave I know that God got a plan and He ain't fulfillin' your destiny Much as I need you, I will not be stickin' around or watchin' you rest in peace I promise, I love you, but I gotta do what's best for me  How can you love someone and learn to let them go? How can we fall apart on things we'll never know? And isn't it funny you can change your ways For someone to fill in your empty space? Tell me, is it really love if you have to ask if they'll stay?  Look, I know you been callin' for me (yeah) You hittin' my phone, but I been alone so long I'm harder to reach (Joyner) I know you ain't say any names,  but I got a feeling you talkin' to me I hate when these demons get into my soul, I feel like I'm caught in the beefs (uh) How do I let go of something I know is bigger and stronger than me? If I could be honest, I'll tell you the truth, I'm not who you want me to be (nah) Nobody is perfect, not even you, so why you keep targettin' me? I feel like we can't even have a genuine convo without you startin' to preach I feel like a dog on a leash, it's not what I need Livin' in hell, warned you when I gotta leave, like how can I breathe? And how you gon' tell me addiction's not a disease? Fuck do you mean? If it's not a disease, then why has it gotten to me? It's not what it seems But you always be makin' me feel like the problem's me I'm not gonna be who you want me to be, let God decide it for me And speakin' of God, how the fuck you know all of the plan's He's gotten for me? So give me a break I been inchin' away from tryna get outta this dream, I'm driftin' away How come you only there for me when I be tryna get clean? My biggest mistake Is me wishin' that things were different, I feel like the drugs is made for sinnin' It's why I been stuck in the same position, fuck I'm fallin', but I cannot budge Been wonderin' why I'm in love with a strange addiction And why the fuck you always playin' the victim Lot of this shit that you hate to mention It sucks 'cause I had to taint your vision But ain't nothin' left for me So you could just quit addressin' me I guess it's just my destiny So take me as I am or let me be, tired of you stressin' me 'Cause shit, I gotta do what's best for me How can you love someone and learn to let them go? How can we fall apart on things we'll never know? And isn't it funny you can change your ways For someone to fill in your empty space? Tell me, is it really love if you have to ask if they'll stay

Love & support brought me this far. I have two brothers who were gripped by addiction and they are in prison. My youngest brother was on meth n shot himself in the face on NYE and got arrested for a gun charge. He was attempting s*icide. Middle brother went to prison for 30 years when he was 21 for a gun crime and hijacking on meth. He has 25 years left before he can be considered for parole. Drugs will rip a family to pieces ğŸ’” i try to be a part of the solution now but what can i do? I get people into treatment but it's not enough. What is the answer? Little over a year off tranq the last time. Started my addiction in 2004 with pills we could get from medicine cabinets in the 9th grade mostly oxy and Xanax. In 2010 I got clean for 5 years until 2015, In 2017/18 I tried again but stayed using after breaking my back hip and shoulder in a car accident and obviously not getting any pain medication but eventually I broke. From 2019-2023 I was addicted to heroin fentanyl cocaine hookers benzos, whatever I wanted I had got a settlement from the car accident and dumb luck invested in crypto and was suddenly a millionaire. I remember when I picked out my luxury apartment I had invited a girl from tinder over and was setting up the place didnâ€™t have furniture even in yet. She asked me about why I picked this place if k could live anywhere, and I said â€œidk itâ€™s hard to pick your coffin, but this feels like as good a place to die as any. â€œ because in that moment I knew like the way I knew the sun would come up tomorrow that one night in this apartment when no one is there but me Iâ€™d end up doing to much Xanax fentanyl and heroin, and Iâ€™d OD before I could get any coke or mdma or whatever to get my CNS from shutting down. And somehow I was so far away from love, from god, from hope, from anything that as a 29 year old millionaire, whoâ€™s smart, good at most things, had been a good person, even in my addicted I didnâ€™t lie cheat steal rip rob and scam to make it happen I paid my dealers extra I treated them with respect (I didnâ€™t have friends) and I told my parents the truth I was a junkie / I didnâ€™t want to have to always lie to them. - but here I was realizing Iâ€™ve probably got a year to live maybe 2â€¦ and the only thing I could think was, damn I wonder how yk make sure someone finds my dog. The next day I took an Uber home to drop my dog off with my parents because I was more worried that my dog would be alone without food when I inevitably killed myself, than I was about actually dying myself.   Turns out everytime I overdosed it just so happened someone was there to find me and get emts.  In 2023 I had lost and spent all the money, including losing my cold wallet keys, and spending about 300 a day on drugs everyday. Usually a brick or two of dope, for 150-300, once a week 500 pills from dark web$2000 another 2 grams of blow every day or two $120-200, and some Xanax, adderal, Valium, whatever I could get in large quantities and looked like fun. Call it another 500-600 a week on random pills. And when ur doing 4-6k worth of drugs a week u canâ€™t cook or clean or take care of urself, sooo, Uber eats 2-4 times a day, Ubers to get anywhere, on demand housekeeping service once a week, vacations and shopping cus I was broke my whole life - escorts and dating apps, another 1-2k per day.   And now I canâ€™t afford to buy groceries, Iâ€™m half a month late with rent, Iâ€™m engaged and own no property have no credit and my job sucks, but Iâ€™m clean: and Iâ€™m alive: and thank you everyone who got me here. I was a meth addict for 7 years. I tried to quit on my own for 3 years. I couldn't do it, until i realized that my wife was pregnant with our first child and knowing and seeing what it's like being addicted to drugs with children in your care, i cried out to God to help me. I didn't have a church background, grew up Buddhism and was an athiest in high school. But that day it was supernatural. I cried out tears running down my face and prayed for him to help me that i didn't want to do this anymore. The next morning i woke up with no come down, no withdraws, no crash no craving. I instantly had no desires of the drugs and have been 8 years clean. All because of Jesus. Praise God!!! I hope this message encourages you too seek a relationship with Jesus and put your faith in him and turn away from your sins. Drugs are spritual and demons are attached to them that is why we crave the addiction. I pray whoever reads this message that you are touched by the overwhelming love of God's pressence right now and that drugs no longer have dominion over you in Jesus name!!

How can you love someone and learn to let them go? How can we fall apart on things we'll never know? And isn't it funny you can change your ways For someone to fill in your empty space? Tell me, is it really love if you have to ask if they'll stay? Yeah, I got somebody I love (yeah) Someone who's really important to me, but now they addicted to drugs (damn) Someone who not who they used to be and we ain't been keepin' in touch (yeah) I ain't gonna say any names at all 'cause I don't want no one to judge (whoa) But I wrote this song in hopes when they'll hear it, they'll never forget who they was I hope you feelin' your spirit enough (Joyner) I wanna just tell you I love you in case that you really don't hear it as much (whoa) I know we ain't talked in a while, but fuck it, I really don't care what it was I wanna reach out, but you keep on shuttin' me down, or you ain't been carin' as much And what the fuck happened to you? (Fuck happened to you?) You're losin' a fight (damn) I never thought I'd see the day that you let addiction ruin your life Everyone callin' that shit a disease and makin' you feel like you in the right But I hate the fact that you really be usin' that as an excuse to do what you like Or do what you might (do what you might, whoa) And I keep on prayin' and reachin' for you I hope you look in the mirror and see all the things I been seein' in you Hope your reflection'll send you a message and show you this shit is much deeper than you If you don't believe in yourself, then you'll never believe in somebody believin' in you When I gotta tell you truth (tell you the truth) 'Cause I'm 'bout to lose it (lose it) And you in denial about it and just wanna make up a million excuses Tearin' our family apart, but you'll leave us scarred and everyone bruises Every decision affectin' us all and if you get lost, then everyone loses For real And I'ma be next to leave I know that God got a plan and He ain't fulfillin' your destiny Much as I need you, I will not be stickin' around or watchin' you rest in peace I promise, I love you, but I gotta do what's best for me  How can you love someone and learn to let them go? How can we fall apart on things we'll never know? And isn't it funny you can change your ways For someone to fill in your empty space? Tell me, is it really love if you have to ask if they'll stay? Look, I know you been callin' for me (yeah) You hittin' my phone, but I been alone so long I'm harder to reach (Joyner) I know you ain't say any names, but I got a feeling you talkin' to me I hate when these demons get into my soul, I feel like I'm caught in the beefs (uh) How do I let go of something I know is bigger and stronger than me? If I could be honest, I'll tell you the truth, I'm not who you want me to be (nah) Nobody is perfect, not even you, so why you keep targettin' me? I feel like we can't even have a genuine convo without you startin' to preach I feel like a dog on a leash, it's not what I need Livin' in hell, warned you when I gotta leave, like how can I breathe? And how you gon' tell me addiction's not a disease? Fuck do you mean? If it's not a disease, then why has it gotten to me? It's not what it seems But you always be makin' me feel like the problem's me I'm not gonna be who you want me to be, let God decide it for me And speakin' of God, how the fuck you know all of the plan's He's gotten for me? So give me a break I been inchin' away from tryna get outta this dream, I'm driftin' away How come you only there for me when I be tryna get clean? My biggest mistake Is me wishin' that things were different, I feel like the drugs is made for sinnin' It's why I been stuck in the same position, fuck I'm fallin', but I cannot budge Been wonderin' why I'm in love with a strange addiction And why the fuck you always playin' the victim Lot of this shit that you hate to mention It sucks 'cause I had to taint your vision But ain't nothin' left for me So you could just quit addressin' me I guess it's just my destiny So take me as I am or let me be, tired of you stressin' me 'Cause shit, I gotta do what's best for me  How can you love someone and learn to let them go? How can we fall apart on things we'll never know? And isn't it funny you can change your ways For someone to fill in your empty space? Tell me, is it really love if you have to ask if they'll stay?

This song is so powerful, my husband played it for me yesterday and I've had it on repeat pretty much since. The 1st verse was me to my ex in my 20s, then my family to me in my 30s, until i began to face the demons in addiction. To realize those demons were roots of pain and trauma from a young age. Then I started speaking up alot more like verse 2 and nobody liked it at 1st. So my husband and I, took our daughter with us and moved away from everyone. We were on our own journey walking in faith, overcoming a past that haunted and crippled us too long. We got clean by letting go of the fight that was too big for us and dealing with the things we could change, our attitude, as we walked through the process of healing, God has began restoring everything. But that's taken a complete different way of thinking and boundaries with family and friends. Who are now beginning to respect us. One of the biggest thought change, was to recognize the  self sabotaging thought patterns and replace them with the rest of my life is the best of my life and shit like that. Well not shit, because it's now beautiful things. I'm 44 now so it's not too late as long as your breathing

By the grace of God in the year of 2011 I believed on the Lord Jesus Christ for the Forgiveness of sins and the Redemption of my Eternal Soul it is by the power of his death burial and resurrection that I was saved from eternal hell In 2013 on the stoop outside my friends apt 3:00 in the morning while smoking a cigarette because I was so messed up on Suboxone and antipsychotics that I couldn't sleep thinking in my mind why does this cigarette and these drugs have such control over me Then a still small voice of God spoke to me and that loving voice asked me a very important question Am I not powerful enough to deliver you from the bondage of your addiction? And I began to think to myself Surely God Is right he was powerful enough to save my soul from Hell surely he can save me from this addiction At that moment I changed my mind about everything I had formerly believed about the drugs and I decided that I was never going to touch them or look at them again it was a commitment that I made to God because of what he did for me on the cross and God delivered me from the bondage of addiction he took away my urge to use drugs and it's because of him that I am sitting here in my right mind able to type these words  Those of you reading this not only do you need to be saved from hell once and for all by grace through faith in Jesus  if you are not already but you need to trust God to deliver you from the addiction and he will  The battle is in your mind but if you seek God he will teach you how to change all that Proverbs 16:3 KJV  BELIEVE ON THE LORD JESUS CHRIST AND THOU SHALT BE SAVEDâ¤

Growing up, my stepsister was addicted to drugs and I didn't understand. I was so mad at her. Coming home from vacation to find every tv in the house missing, my parents trying over and over again to get her clean. I hated her for what she was doing to us. I joined the Army, I went off to make my own life. I thoight I was so much better than her. *Then God humbled me greatly.*  We are all one step away from losing ourselves. I didnt understand back then. Now I do.   The human body is such a difficult place for every soul to reside. The answer is God-- seeking Christ. I know now that this is so much deeper than just this world. This is a spirtual sickness sweeping our land, our whole earth. If you hear me, please, pray for me, and read your bible. If I leave nothing else behind when it's my time to go, I hope I leave a testimony to the Truth.

I'm 6 years clean from pain pills an Fet and opanas. It was the hardest fight I ever fought. This hit hard! Reading the comments even got me with that lump in the throat feeling smh! Ive bÃ¨en secretly dealing with an addiction to klonopin for going on 12 yrs now, came home from an 11 yr prison bid n thought i had the world by the balls, always knew i dealt with some form of depression but it just never hit me until after all that time its crazy but my dad was shot n killed in kensington when i was 2 months old, then my mother who also dealt with her own issues n addiction didnt answer her phone al day so i went to check on her n found her with a cord aroundd her neck at 14, within the next few months i was confused n angry n sht happend n i got bounced around to almost every juvenile placement in PA, even caught new charges in a few smh, then 18 straight to county then state and maxed out! 2012 i thought the fight was over, never tlkd about my parents tho as i felt like as a man we are suppose to keep our heads up chest out n keep playing the hand God hand dealt, i felt id be looked at as weak idk! But a few weeks being home i was going to get a haircut n got to front door n everything turned black, heart pounding etc, Hospital said idt was anxiety n gave me xanax, all i knew was it made me feel like finally i feel better then Dr's kept me on n would even seem mad if i asked them whats the end game or can they taper me, i never told anybody though, all i have is an aunt outta state n a 76 yr old grandmother n we dnt really speak so time went on, working paying bills then slowly but surely i got to the point of waking up n staring at electrical cords similar to the one my mom used wishing i had the ball's but theres also apart of me that absolutely refuses to give up on myself and i honestly dnt know why! Never played the poor me card ever either but ive also allowed ppl around me bc i saw them hurting n needing help n would be there everytime n now that ive hit this point, everybody took my kindness for weakness n thats cool whatever maybe i was helping bc i always wished someone was there to just give me a hand, not a handout just a hand to guide me in the right direction! Now ive lost my job, most likely end up homeless n if thats God's plan im ok with it! I pray nobody ever feels this pain we all probably similarly feel bc addiction is addiction regardless! Sorry this is long, but im just at the point where idc who thinks what bc no matter what, were all human n nobody is perfect im just so tired of this lifestyle n medication n the fkd up part, ive never overtaken or made myself run out ever ive stayed at 2mg its just the length of time on n seeing someone die in my cell from a benzo withdrawal/seizure to stories i read online, I am just scared its just no getting out of this hole but seeing ppl talk about getting clean n living better lives again gives me some bit of hope! Addictions may be different but we are still feeling trapped in the same cycle so thats why ive never judged anybody bc i saw that hurt n pain i was only masking to cover up my own issues in those same ppl! I pray everybody finds that peace they are searching for n never give up bc i know for a fact, even for me, there is light at the end and we'll be free wishing we opened up alot sooner!ğŸ™ğŸ»

Unless youâ€™ve been an addict of drugs or alcohol regardless if youâ€™re related to or know an addict, you will NEVER truly understand the immense amount of pain, suffering, hopelessness, and trauma associated with being an addict. It is single handedly the worst thing you could ever experience or wish upon someone else to experience. I would never wish that on anyone. From 2015 to 2021 I was addicted to Percocet and heroin. I lost friends, family, vehicles, homes, my college degree, good jobs, my license, my freedom, and my soulmate. I finally got clean and am going on two years and 6 months. He didnâ€™t make it. When he died, a part of me died too. June will mark two years since he died and I still bawl my eyes out everyday. He deserved better. Iâ€™m clean today, and itâ€™s thanks to him. Even having parents who have been addicts my whole life, they still donâ€™t understand from this songâ€™s point of view. Iâ€™ve been waiting for a song like this. You two are definitely people who feel us, in your mind, in your heart, and in our soul. You know the pain. You empathize, you sympathize, and you care. We need more people in the world like you who speak volumes for people like us. Judging is easy. But to put ego and opinions and blame aside to really want to know or understand to bring resolve or peace or to heal the struggling, thats a miracle right there. You deserve all the recognition and so much more for this right here. I hope you guys put more out like this. I have nothing but respect for you guys. Thank you so so much for your part in healing lives. â¤

Gives me goosebumps, Iâ€™m a former addict, and I have friends and family Iâ€™ve lost to drugs and alcohol. The best music is when artists speak from their own personal experiences, and the greats can articulate and draw you in with gifted lyrics from their heart and soul. Joyner Lucas got screwed over by record labels who continue to exploit artists and steal all their money, but Joyner came over that with his manager who actually believed in him and wanted to see him succeed. In the Math Hoffa podcast Joyner and his manager said the real work starts when you get signed to a label, if you think you made it just by getting signed you will end up broke and possibly even losing the rights to most of your music. Math Hoffa and his crew really do try and promote positive things, and want to educate these young men out here to becoming stronger and wiser.

*Hook* How can you love someone and learn to let them go? How can we fall apart on things we'll never know? And isn't it funny you can change your ways For someone to fill in your empty space? Tell me, is it really love if you have to ask if they'll stay?  *Verse 1* Yeah, I got somebody I love (yeah) Someone who's really important to me, but now they addicted to drugs (damn) Someone who not who they used to be and we ain't been keepin' in touch (yeah) I ain't gonna say any names at all 'cause I don't want no one to judge (whoa) But I wrote this song in hopes when they'll hear it, they'll never forget who they was I hope you feelin' your spirit enough (Joyner) I wanna just tell you I love you in case that you really don't hear it as much (whoa) I know we ain't talked in a while, but fuck it, I really don't care what it was I wanna reach out, but you keep on shuttin' me down, or you ain't been carin' as much And what the fuck happened to you? (Fuck happened to you?) You're losin' a fight (damn) I never thought I'd see the day that you let addiction ruin your life Everyone callin' that shit a disease and makin' you feel like you in the right But I hate the fact that you really be usin' that as an excuse to do what you like Or do what you might (do what you might, whoa) And I keep on prayin' and reachin' for you I hope you look in the mirror and see all the things I been seein' in you Hope your reflection'll send you a message and show you this shit is much deeper than you If you don't believe in yourself, then you'll never believe in somebody believin' in you When I gotta tell you truth (tell you the truth) 'Cause I'm 'bout to lose it (lose it) And you in denial about it and just wanna make up a million excuses Tearin' our family apart, but you'll leave us scarred and everyone bruises Every decision affectin' us all and if you get lost, then everyone loses For real And I'ma be next to leave I know that God got a plan and He ain't fulfillin' your destiny Much as I need you, I will not be stickin' around or watchin' you rest in peace I promise, I love you, but I gotta do what's best for me   *Hook* How can you love someone and learn to let them go? How can we fall apart on things we'll never know? And isn't it funny you can change your ways For someone to fill in your empty space? Tell me, is it really love if you have to ask if they'll stay?   Verse 2: Look, I know you been callin' for me (yeah) You hittin' my phone, but I been alone so long I'm harder to reach (Joyner) I know you ain't say any names, but I got a feeling you talkin' to me I hate when these demons get into my soul, I feel like I'm caught in the beefs (uh) How do I let go of something I know is bigger and stronger than me? If I could be honest, I'll tell you the truth, I'm not who you want me to be (nah) Nobody is perfect, not even you, so why you keep targettin' me? I feel like we can't even have a genuine convo without you startin' to preach I feel like a dog on a leash, it's not what I need Livin' in hell, warned you when I gotta leave, like how can I breathe? And how you gon' tell me addiction's not a disease? Fuck do you mean? If it's not a disease, then why has it gotten to me? It's not what it seems But you always be makin' me feel like the problem's me I'm not gonna be who you want me to be, let God decide it for me And speakin' of God, how the fuck you know all of the plan's He's gotten for me? So give me a break I been inchin' away from tryna get outta this dream, I'm driftin' away How come you only there for me when I be tryna get clean? My biggest mistake Is me wishin' that things were different, I feel like the drugs is made for sinnin' It's why I been stuck in the same position, fuck I'm fallin', but I cannot budge Been wonderin' why I'm in love with a strange addiction And why the fuck you always playin' the victim Lot of this shit that you hate to mention It sucks 'cause I had to taint your vision But ain't nothin' left for me So you could just quit addressin' me I guess it's just my destiny So take me as I am or let me be, tired of you stressin' me 'Cause shit, I gotta do what's best for me  *Hook* How can you love someone and learn to let them go? How can we fall apart on things we'll never know? And isn't it funny you can change your ways For someone to fill in your empty space? Tell me, is it really love if you have to ask if they'll stay?

Reebok omni pumps!!
Heroin, pill and cocaine addict for 7 years, I choose to get sober 8 years ago and never looked back. I was homeless, in jail, mountains of debt and lost everything I ever owned I never thought I would get my own place to live or be an independent functioning member of society. Now I have built my own home, have 3 beautiful girls and everything I could ever want. Every once in a while a song really hits me and reminds me of how lucky I am to be out of that life and to remind those still fighting they can make it out too! As hard as it is to make it through, it's incredible on the other side and I am grateful everyday that I lived long enough to be ready to get sober. I tried for years, in and out of rehabs, cold turkey, family helping, friends helping but it didn't happen until I had truly just had enough of living that way. I was looking at possibly year's of jail when I decided to finally stick with it. It took me 60+ days in jail and rehab, if I had left sooner I would of relapsed. It was the only time I actually worked at it and wanted it. Several people I used to know and hang out with weren't so lucky and they overdosed while trying to get sober or they just never made it that far. To the loved ones of addicts, they do need you, please don't enable them as it only prolongs their use, but that doesn't mean you can't still love them, talk to them, support them mentally and be there to help when they are ready because they will need you when they are. My family never gave up on me and if they had I don't know if things would of turned out the same. Forever thankful to be where I am today, 8 years clean and sober from all substances.
I'm playing Russian rolet listen to this and 3 songs later I found 3 times my gun should've went off! I'm trying my best to find my purpose when I work my ass off for nothing it seems like!

This song dropped just a few days after I lost one of my best guy friends to alcholism. He was doing so great! 2 years sober, then one night, the deamons came back. We hadn't heard from him for a couple of days, so the police were called to do a welfare check. He was found deceased with alcohol bottles scattered around his body. He was such an amazing man. He had a rough life growing up. His mom was found dead at the bottom of their stairs. I remember the police knocking on our classroom door in kindergarten. Addiction is so not fair. There needs to be easier access to help for Addiction & Mental heath. Both are combined. Most addicts have a mental health problem or suffer from depression. This country needs to step it up before addiction & mental health problems take more of our loved ones. Addiction doesn't discriminate!! â¤

This song hit home, I lost my parents 6 months ago in a murder suicide. My father was a severe alcoholic with severe PTSD that ended up with him resorting to using drugs as well in the end to help him "cope". He refused to get help, no matter what we told him. All we showed was love and concern and he decided to do something that destroyed both my younger brother and my life forever. This song definitely expresses what we are battling and what we were going thru when they were still around. For those of you that are battling drugs or struggling to deal with your vices, just think about what you may be putting your kids/family thru when you take your dose. Its not only affecting you, its affecting the people that love you, even if it may seem to you that its not.

Thank you Mr Lucas
I just wanted to take a moment to appreciate your incredible artistry. Not only does it have a profound impact, but it's also relevant and thought-provoking. Your music has the power to make us love differently, think differently, and approach the world in a whole new way.  I still remember the first time I heard one of his songs. I'm here, like the thousands of others who battle addiction every day. Its been close to 8 years since I've touched a pain pill and booze. By the age of 16 I was a drunk. By 18 I was a full blown alcoholic. Somehow I managed to graduate HS and move down to the lower 48 (I currently still live in North Pole, Alaska) and by 20 I was hooked on pain pills after a really bad crash racing quads. Here I am almost 36, single dad with an angel who turns 8 this coming May. That angel happens to be my daughter, who came into this world and saved my life. And she knows it. I have told her many times. When she is old enough, and wants to know how, we will have that discussion.   My prayers go out to anyone & everyone who deals with addiction. You, Yourself, a loved one, family member, anyone. Just know you aren't alone.

This song hits extra hard. I feel this in my heart
i wrote this as a response to another persons comment, but i figured i I might as well share it here as it might help someone somewhere understand it a little better. and if it does, that's good for me.  hey man, that's all you can do. i'm coming up on 7 years in recovery. I know how rough it can be for him. and on the other hand, being in recovery has given me an outlook somewhat similar to yours, though i pray i never have to fully understand what you're going through as i have an almost 5 year old son and 2.5 year old daughter.. but you can only try to set an example without making them feel like they're not understood or not important. it's like the normalcy of how one's brain works, how some might put it as "the old them," becomes hijacked from drugs and what used to bring them joy and happiness is now suddenly not important as the drugs are now what synthetically fuels the brains endorphins, dopamines etc.. on a chemical level, metaphorically, the brain is the factory, and all the usual characters like dopamine and endorphins are the workers employed there.. once a person becomes 'addicted' to a substance, particularly opiates, the substance is now synthetically employing other workers. Let's picture them as machines, robots, etc.. now when you start withdrawal, that's when the machines break down, therefore the brain is essentially shutdown and that creates a problem regarding the reward pathway of the brain, they become upset easily, angry and frustrated in the blink of an eye, and on top of it all they're going through withdrawal on a physical level, often misunderstood, and it's usually because people don't care to understand what's going on. they become antisocial and drawn away. usually this step ends up causing people to relapse unfortunately, being that the uncomfortable process of physical withdrawal is rough on the body, as is most substances alike, buts its def not the end of the road. if people are mentally ready, they can get through the physical withdrawal and then they'll start to feel extremely good, proud of how far they've come, which is when the pink cloud effect takes over. you feel like you have your old self back again and you can come to terms with what you did and how you've changed and you WANT to see that proud smile across your families face when they see you.. then the pink cloud phase ends, and something called PAWS (post acute withdrawal syndrome) comes creeping up, and this is, imo, the worst part of it all. this part is associated with your brain (the factory that's been shut down, so to say,) and fully coming to terms with the fact that it's been synthetically fed endorphins particularly and hasn't had to produce any endorphins itself for however long the addiction has been, be it 1 year or 15+, the longer the addiction the harder and more dragged out the process is, and it starts realizing it has to begin to go back to work after being "laid off" for 15 years or whatever.. it's going to take time, usually about 1 year, before your brain TRULY feels like itself again. there are times when you feel happy, rewarded, etc, but it's not essentially the same as the person who hasn't put themselves in the position of addiction. another big thing, and i speak from experience, but others might feel completely different, is arrested development.. it's essentially the brain not being allowed to "age" with the rest of the body, causing the person to usually act in an immature manner. i was roughly in addiction from 16-26, i tended to use more frequently when problems arose in my life and instead of facing them, processing them and dealing with them in the age appropriate manner, i "numbed" myself to not feel anything. unfortunately, your brain needs to go through those types of things in a raw, unadulterated way so it can "ripen" from those experiences, both good and bad, and what you get after going from 16-26 without the use of substances is a person who usually knows how to handle life's problems with, for the most part, dignity and in a mature age appropriate manner. sometimes people deal with things better and some worse. but using substances, and usually unbeknownst to the user, is not a good thing at all for the brain and as i mentioned before, oftentimes leaves a person who's for instance 30 years old, acting like a juvenile and once again misunderstood from many people around them. but because they don't know any other way to confront, process and deal with these issues, they in return feel betrayed or abandoned from whoever because they're just displaying what they essentially know on a brain chemical level and usually end up feeling defeated and the only thing they know to do is use at that point..  to not feel that pain, that hurt, that sense of abandonment, that misunderstood feeling. It's a brutal cycle, and honestly, a lot of people didn't sign up for all that mentioned above.. for me, i didn't understand what i was doing to myself in that sense, and it's taken a long time to become somebody i could feel proud of, but i eventually did. it's possible. you just need to want it in every part of your body, especially your brain. all anyone can do is be more open on communication, more open to not judging one another and trying to understand the next person as you don't know what they're going through, and being there for eachother as much as people allow. sometimes you do have to fight for what you love, but unfortunately, it all comes down to the person and how much they want to truly live. â¤
I am trying. But the pills and drugs and smokes are the only thing that be making me feel like I can be set free. I am sorry for what I become. To learn what it takes to be self love. I am sorry to the ones that I hurt. I had to learn the way I avoided my whole life. I am only human. My whole life felt like an alien because of how I treated. Now it's become how I treat myself. Wishing upon stars maybe someone could see the light behind my eyes. And maybe someone could see the real me behind my scars. I wanna write music, but I have a deaf father who matters to me. wanting to make him proud keeps me sheltered back, from my future. How can I make my father proud when I cry? And he tells me in a joking manner "everything is your fault, don't cry son" How can I stop. Myself from falling apart, from ways I become. From things I have thought, but never done. All my life spent trying to repent from things I was stuck in the worst prison of all. Nothing you could ever do to me, ever amounts to what I have done to myself inside my own mind.

I hear this song from both sides and understand it all fully. I am a recovering addict, I've been clean for 7 years. My children watched me destroy my life and myself and, although they were young adults at the worst of my addiction, I know it affected them greatly. When my son told me that his girlfriend was pregnant and I was going to be a grandma, I made the decision to get clean because I didn't want my grandbaby to ever know the "me" that was the addict.  Now, my son is adicted to cocaine. I can't help but blame myself for some of the hurt he tries to numb, but ultimately an addict makes their own decisions and I can't decide for him that be needs to quit or needs help. I want desperately for him to see that he's losing everything he has worked for. My grandson's are witnessing what I never wanted them to see. Someone they love addicted to drugs. My son is just the ghost of who he once was. I want him back, but he has to choose that for himself. I can only shelter my grandsons from the reality of life at the moment, but I can't always do that. Y'all pray for my son, please. He needs an awakening. I'm gonna send him this song. I know how it affected me when I heard it, I pray he hears what I do. Thank you @JoinerLucasOfficial for this look into the lives of those affected by addiction. It's a masterpiece. ğŸ’–ğŸ’¯ğŸ’ªğŸ½

This is classic
Hey loves. This is a love letter for anyone addicted to drugs. It is not the drugs that is the problem. The problem is a spiritual, relational, mental, and physical one. I love the outcasts of society. Sometimes I feel the most peace and understanding around them. My demons play with their demons and sometimes we have the funnest times. We tell funny ass stories. We tell each other our inner darkest secrets and feel connected,  we have some of the hottest, sexiest, wildest sex. And when I can't handle my life, I submit and let them control me. That's toxic relationships and trauma bonding. And the flip side is yall can trigger the shit out of each other, manipulate, and point out weaknesses, and destroy each other over arguments or shitty situations. People use drugs to escape, party, boredom, etc. Just like people use all kinds of other things. Social media, porn, video games, food, people etc. If you want to be free you have got to stop playing the victim and giving your control up. Stop giving it to professionals, programs, rehabs, family, substances, etc. Be willing to be open minded and desperate. Try everything but be smart about it. When you call bullshit, don't get mad. Politely say this is not for me, and try something else. If you have extensive trauma history where a man has violated you. Ask if they have a female provider. And vice versa. You are all very smart, creative, and funny people. You just get stuck in the lies and bullshit. You come from families that didn't teach healthy boundaries, or emotional, or you  regulation,  or you got into a program, church, rehab, psych ward, jail, prison etc. And someone used their authority to violate you and control you. And when you spoke up, they lied about you. Maybe you even got kicked out because of it. Deep down you have a longing to be loved and safe. I get that. I relate. But baby. Your not going to find that in a substance, a person, a program, etc. Your going to find that in you. Your going to have to take one step at a time. And baby that is painful. I get it. But you don't need jelly rolls song save me. You don't need a man or woman or program to save you. You need to open your eyes and be honest with yourself. Quit speaking lies about your life. Yes u were hurt and it killed you. So much that u can't live anymore. You can't cope anymore. And you just keep hurting the people around you. You keep hurting you. Some of yall got blessed with kids. Some of those kids are in the system or on drugs. You might not believe in God. But something or someone helped make a kid for you. And you were blessed. That kid needs you. Let that be your therapy. Fuck dad and mom. Uncles aunts whoever messed with you. Be the parent that you needed. If you need to use your kid as a crutch to start the change, that's fine. Take it one day at a time. And eventually it won't just be about the kid. It will be about you, your kid, their kids, your work, your family, your hobbies, your finances, your talents. Maybe one day you can even use your story to help others. I've been married to two drug addicts, one was a felon.  I just got out of a traumatic relationship with a drug addict and felon. I use those labels because that is their past. I loved these men. But I had to leave all of them. Because they were abusing me and killing themselves. My second husband wrote books. Robert gallant vodka vagabonds and victory. When I met that man he was living in a halfway house. Just got out of prison.  The first week he knew me he told me he was going to marry me. I thought the man was ugly and short. Lol. He had nothing to offer me. But the thing about me was I love God. But because of my past as a severe trauma victim of men, and my time as a prostitute. My drug of choice is men. The more messed up the better. Lmao. I go into captin save a ho mode. Like my ex said. And I'm wiling to lay down my life for the man I love. I let drug addicts and felons in my home. In my finances. In my heart, soul, body and mind. I sacrifice myself because I know the pain behind those eyes. I see the guilt shame hate when they use drugs and are aware of the consequences.  My second husband Robert had sobriety for 10 years. But his body and life was so fucked up, that my man lost his life to alcoholism. He came to me with hep c, cirrhosis,  mental issues, anger issues, criminal background. And he lost his life on my daughter's birthday. Funny huh. The doctor told me even if he didn't go back to drugs he would have passed soon anyways. He died in 2021 and I gave up. I let the psych Dr's have me and pump my body full of drugs and label me ptsd, bipolar, borderline personality disorder. The funny thing is yes I probably have some of those diagnosis. But that is not a death sentence. Just think of it as a personality and figure out a way to manage it. He died in 2021 and in 2024 I was in a program for human trafficking and strippers. I was so spiritually abused that I was convinced to go off psych meds and this mentor who was supposed to just love on me and teach me the Bible instead did hard-core deliverance ministry on me. I actually knew her as a friend. So she knew my story. But that was not her role. And she traumatized the fuck out of me. Not to mention the program gave me a shitty therapist and I made my boyfriend sign up. The people that had authority in those roles over me and my boyfriend could had done very bad harm. I could have killed myself, he could have hurt me, or himself, or he could have used hard drugs. You have to use programs, people, gurus, etc in authority positions with a grain of salt. If you feel their bullshit or feel unsafe you have a right to speak with someone above them. You habe a right to not take medicine or disagree with them. Sometimes they might get mad and try and lie about you. You have to keep your emotions under control. Read about borderline personality disorder and providers. Some providers hate treating bpd people because they are hard to treat. Lol duh. It's cause they recognize bullshit. Some of yall are hustlers. You got game. You got skills. You have street smarts. You have to learn how to use that in the correct way and you will get your point across. If you take drugs and become in psychosis and end up in the psych ward. Don't get scared, chill. Play games in your mind. Listen to the sounds and stories of the other patients. Don't let it scare you. You are in a safe place. They just want to make sure you are not going to hurt yourself or others. Come down from the drugs and be honest. You don't have to go into a long history. Short and straight facts like I got really upset and got high and I guess it was laced. Psych doctors don't need to know your life story. You aren't going to be in there for long. And if you are homeless stop using it to sleep. Lmao. I pissed a medical dr off and he backeracted me for 12 hours. It took them 12 hours for me to see a psych Dr. That's ridiculous.  But while I waited there was a man on drugs. And he was crying out to God. God am I crazy? What's wrong with me? Etc. Hearing that helped calm me. Or the huge black homeless man doped up on seroquel and depakote. He snored almost the entire 12 hours I was there. And I can tell you that was the most soothing noise. It reminded me of sleeping next to my Ex. Anyways I digress. I want you tonight to make a pact with yourself. No matter what happens your are no longer going to say shitty things to yourself. Or shame yourself when you mess up or your family calls you a pos. Be truthful and honest with yourself. Did I do behaviors while I was high that sound like a pos person? If yes then recognize, forgive yourself, and make amends. Forgive the people that hurt you, not for them and it doesn't mean the behavior was ok. Do it for yourself. So you can move on and they no longer rent space in your head. You have the power to change. It's ok to go in the past if u need to understand or work things out. But don't live their and don't use it to bleed on others, or to manipulate others. Ask yourself what you truly want. Write it down. Draw it in a picture. Post it wherever you can and give yourself a timeline. And when you mess up find a higher power and pray to it. I think there's even a church called the flying spegatti monster. Lmao. Pray to that. Get out of your head and your shame. When your spiraling and you want to use, do grounding techniques. 5 senses. Smell taste etc. Get some sexy perfume and smell it, eat something sour. I love sour patch kids. Etc. You got this. You can do it. Jelly roll did it. You can too. And baby if your gonna use make sure you know what's in that shit. Cause I don't want u to take a fentanly nap. Your too important to me and your loved ones. And your story and struggle needs to be heard. Watch the movie love is not enough with Wynonna Ryder on the plex app. It's free. Stay safe. Be thankful for the people still in your life. And don't buy into the rock bottom bullshit. You don't have to hit rock bottom to change.

I love Joyner and I fuck with this song. But believe me, addiction is a disease that there is no cure for. Itâ€™s a disease of the mind, body and soul. I struggled with booze then dope and benzos for over a decade. I tried everything within my power to quit. Impossible. My best thinking is what kept me from being able to stop. Tapering off 100mg+ of methadone twice. Just to fall back into one of my vices and then picking up right where I left off. It wasnâ€™t until one of a few trips to the ER that I had had enough, my family surrounded me crying, fearful, afraid. I committed to 60 days inpatient rehab, lived in a sober house for a year, with other men like me. People that no matter how fucked up something I had done or was feelingâ€¦they understood. Iâ€™m not saying my path is for everyone. But I had to separate myself from everything and everyone. Showing up to rehab with a pair of sneakers and an and some clothes in a trash bag. But listen, this is the big one. Itâ€™s not a disease that you can give someone. Itâ€™s a disease that affects your loved ones by making them sick. Always worrying if alive, where you are, the days/weeks with no contact. It will make anyone who truly cares about you spiritually and mentally sick. In my case the only one I had left who cared was my mom. I had to get clean for myself and I did back in 2018. Our relationship has NEVER been better. I believe I was born an addict. It just manifested itself in other waysâ€¦until I found drugs and alcohol. So yes, addiction is a disease and you can give it to people. They are going to be sick and suffer until you get betterâ€¦or die and then move on. It took my mom ALANON meetings, therapy and most importantly seeing me clean and happy before she could start healing. Remember that. Iâ€™ve heard other addicts tell me that never stole anything. Beleive me, you stole someoneâ€™s piece of mind, while they were worried sick about you. Lastly, to anyone out there still sick and suffering. Reach out. There are resources. I knew nothing about getting help until I truly decided it was time to try. Start at the hospital and get a psych evaluation. They can refer you to places where there are good people who thrive off giving back. I work in a hospital now and I have seen the sickest of the sick, rock bottom, walking death come back to visit months later a completely new person. A new outlook on life, just glowing. To all those with loved ones still going through it. As hard as it will be, you cannot enable an addict. An addict will lie, cheat and steal to get to that next fix. Itâ€™s fact that in active addiction it affects the part of your brain that tells you if you donâ€™t get your fix, you will die. Your brain lying to you and making the only thing you care about is when, where and how am I getting my next sniff, shot or smoke. Addicts are some of the coolest most lovable people Iâ€™ve ever met once they have recovered from that hopeless state of mind. Completely different than when they are out running and gunning. Itâ€™s a miserable way to live, trust me. If you are worried what people will think if you head to treatment. Fuck them. You donâ€™t want them in your life anyway. One of the hardest parts for me was getting over the stigma. Now I have no problem being open with complete strangers. Iâ€™m proud of my accomplishments and so will you. God bless you all. Sorry for the rant but Iâ€™ve lost too many friends to this and the more we talk about it, the more we break down those stigma walls. If you want to hear a song that really breaks it down what itâ€™s like to live the life of an addict pull up â€œdrug addiction - Colicchieâ€. I still get chills when I listen to it. I heard him speak once. Real down to earth dude. Gives back. Thatâ€™s what itâ€™s all about in the end. If you canâ€™t get out of your head, do something for someone else. It works.

In orher words people go crazy most times out of a strong will to live and survive and those primal   necessities a human body needs to stay alive as in food shelter and cool wits clear  mind to solve problems they believe its 100% or DEATH and it sets them up for a worse and more destructive fall if they have a few beers or smoke some tree. Dope is bad enough but the other doors you open your body mind and soul to injecting anything a man in the street puts in a bag and sells you it could be death so many different ways other than an overdose of heroin. There's more narcan flying around the streets that its not going to be the actual dope mist times that takes you out. Its the infectious and poisonous cutting agents It's the potent fentanyl and research chemical derivatives added its anything the man says is whatever he knows you crave. Most addicts thees days get home and are not happy with what they have and its not what they crave it makes them need it more while their bodies are fighting the damages of the first bags of poison injected. Most aren't even cleared for human consumption Im just saying try to get him in a mind frame of hurting himself less rather than expecting total abstinence from all mind Altering substance. Because like it or not almost everyone in America has their own substance list for the comforts recieved whether it's chamomile or lavender tea or dope fein lean. Everyone self medicates in their own ways. Push healthier ways and alternative methids of finding peace within and over time it will naturally progress into a life he doesn't hate to live. And remember EVERYONE I KNOW IN ADDICTION GETS LEFT IN THE WIND BY THEYRE LOVED ONES AND LONELINESS IS ONE OF THE MOST CRIPPLING AFFECTS TO MAN AND HIS WILL TO LIVE A LIFE WORTH LIVING. STOP ENABLING BUT NEVER STOP CHECKING IN, SHOWING UP, CALLING REGULARLY TO MAKE SURE THEY ARE NOT ALONE AND STRUGGLING IN OTHER WAYS. H.A.L.T. AS WELL TELL HIM WHEN HE FINDS HIMSELF CRAVING. CHECK HIMSELF. IS HE HUNGRY ANGRY LONELY TIRED? AND FIX THOSE THINGS FIRST BEFORE PICKING UP HARM REDUCTION AND UNDERSTANDING PROGRESS OVER PERFECTION WHEN IT COMES TO ABSTINENCE AND SLIPS IVE BEEN PHYSICALLY ADDICTED TO ALCOHOL FOR SEVERAL YEARS AND HAD A SLIGHT ADDICTION TO SUBOXONE ACTUALLY AND THREW A COUPLE YEARS TO THE STIMULANTS AND SUCH AFTER GETTING BOOZE IN CHECK. This song is so deep, and it really hits home.  Wow.  You all did an amazing job! Brought me to tears.  I've lost so many friends n family to drugs. An addiction is 1 of the worst things in this entire world to overcome.  People feel empty inside, and they turn to the wrong things to fill that void. Not even thinking about the consequences that will follow. Over time, they become empty inside all over again, even  while they are still using,  just to feel normal and keep from feeling sick. It's heartbreaking. They slowly keep reaching for more n more links to a chain until they have held their own self captive,  no matter how hard they try.  And they don't have a key. Only then they realize they've lost everyone n everything.  No 1 trusts them anymore, n they've burned all bridges to everyone that did or does love them.  They are bound n stuck in this vicious cycle that just goes round n round like a Merry go  round, and they are too scared to jump off. It takes more willpower, strength, courage, and discipline than anyone could ever imagine. Most people never become free fr the chains n never succeed.  If they can withstand the pain mentally n physically, that comes with the Nightmares that they are facing, then they are 1 of the Lucky 1's that has been GRACED BY GOD!!!!!! And if they don't make it and they let only 1 Demon in, 7 more will follow.  MAY GOD BE WITH THEM AND HAVE MERCY ON THEIR SOULS.  AMEN
